intro: Gnaphalium canum, commonly known as field sandwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Gnaphalium canum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
